data.title: Good Food, Fun Atmosphere
data.text: One of our favorite restaurants in Corona.  We typically go there about 6 times a year for celebrations - birthdays, graduations, new jobs, promotions, etc.  Almost always have very good experiences.  Food from the Teppan Grill always fresh and tasty.  Steak, chicken, lobster always fresh, cooked to order.  I do have one minor complaint.  Normally we go with 6-8 people so we drop well over $200 per visit.  Last time we were there, one in our party asked for an additional bowl of steamed rice.  No problem, they brought it very promptly.  When I got the bill, they charged us $1.50 for the extra rice.  Really?  Between drinks, apps, dinner, etc. we spend close to $250 and they charge us $1.50 for a nickel's worth of rice?  Thought that was pretty cheap of them.  Because of that, the next party we had, we went to Spaghetti Factory.  So that $1.50 cost THEM over $200.  It didn't stop of from coming back, but it did cost them.  Service is generally good but the "show" is getting a little tired - "butter fly" Choo Choo train, egg roll........ time to come up with new material.

data.title: We Came To Sushi and Steak!!! Muy Bueno!!!
data.text: I have to admit, I'm not the biggest fan of eating raw fish (Though I'm a Bear...) I'm Spoiled, I like it Fried or Baked!!! However, that might be changing. My guy pal and I jammed down on Sushi and more at SGC Sushi and Hibachi Grill - I liked the selections provided. 'Sheppy' had primarily the sushi items from "All You Can Eat" list - while I had Cajon steak dinner dish while sampling sushi items (with permission) off my friends plate. Overall, I enjoyed the experience. My friend only goes there for the sushi, so if I go back I'll stick to their sushi bar and sample more salmon!! Four Claws UP!!!! Peace Out! Joe G. Bear

data.title: We love SGC!
data.text: My family and I have been to SGC at least a dozen times.  We go for almost every birthday and special occasion.  Our young kids love the hibachi steak and enjoy watching the chefs cook for them.  The sushi is very yummy and fresh too.  Great staff also.  If you love Benihana or hibachi, you'll enjoy SGC.

data.title: Best Place In Corona for Japanese Food & Sushi
data.text: This is the go-to place in Corona for sushi and Japanese food.  You have a choice of going to the left side of the restaurant which is teppan-style which is like benihana.  They cook right in front of you on a flat grill.  The chefs are very entertaining and best in a group.  The right side of the restaurant is more like a Japanese restaurant/sushi bar.  The sushi here is always fresh and they are generous.  I hate places that give you small pieces of fish...not here.  They also have an all you can eat sushi menu for lunch and dinner....well worth the price.  They even have a special room in the back for groups and special events.  This place is also very kid friendly - they give the kiddies a lollipop on a long stick....Very nice!

data.title: Awesome food, great price
data.text: I was in Corona on business and decided to try this place.  Very glad I did.  All you can eat for $22.95.  Food was great.  Chefs and wait staff were very friendly.  Had me try sushi rolls I had never tried before, and they did not disappoint.  Highly recommended!

data.title: Good Japanese place.  Not a great show, but the food is excellent.
data.text: Good Japanese place.  Not a great show, but the food is excellent.

data.title: 和食レストランではない
data.text: 入店すると寿司と鉄板焼きのどちらにするかを聞かれます。鮨テーブルを選択し、定職を食べました。よくあるアメリカナイズされた日本食レストランで、パリパリに揚げられた天ぷら、甘いたれがかかっただけの照り焼きチキン等、日本人からするとちょっと違うというものばかりでした。
